meanings.definition: Moving from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The locomoting train chugged along the tracks.
meanings.sent2: The fast cheetah is a locomoting animal.
meanings.sent3: The snail's locomoting pace amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The river's locomoting flow carried debris downstream.
meanings.sent5: The locomoting clouds drifted lazily across the sky.

meanings.definition: The act of traveling from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The locomoting of the car was smooth on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The airplane's locomoting was disrupted by bad weather.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's locomoting on ice looked comical.
meanings.sent4: The locomoting of time never stops, always moving forward.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship's locomoting through space was a marvel of engineering.
